Serialized Form

  • Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.ActiveAgent extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • rowPosition

          int rowPosition
          This field represents the position in the row of the object, which will eventually be used for interactions (killing, moving) and for the map. It is in the ActiveAgent.ActiveAgent(int, int) constructor, ActiveAgent.setPosition(int, int), and ActiveAgent.getRow() methods.

        • colPosition

          int colPosition
          This field represents the position in the column of the object, which will eventually be used for interactions (killing, moving) and for the map. It is in the ActiveAgent.ActiveAgent(int, int) constructor, ActiveAgent.setPosition(int, int), and ActiveAgent.getCol() methods.

        • previousRow

          int previousRow
          This represents the previous ActiveAgent.rowPosition of the object. It has two functions: (a) To reset the previous map coordinate to empty (b) As a "breadcrumb" trail for enemies to look for when in Pursuit It is used in the ActiveAgent.setPosition(int, int), ActiveAgent.adjustTemps(int, int), and ActiveAgent.getOldRow() methods.

        • previousCol

          int previousCol
          This represents the previous ActiveAgent.colPosition of the object. It has two functions: (a) To reset the previous map coordinate to empty (b) As a "breadcrumb" trail for enemies to look for when in Pursuit It is used in the #setPositions(int, int), ActiveAgent.adjustTemps(int, int), and ActiveAgent.getOldCol() methods.

        • possibleRow

          int possibleRow
          This represents the possible future ActiveAgent.rowPosition of the object. It is meant to help determine if it will be okay to be placed there, in ActiveAgent.isChangeInRange(). It is set during ActiveAgent.setPossibleRC(int, int) and ActiveAgent.adjustTemps(int, int). It can be retrieved by ActiveAgent.getPossibleRow().

        • possibleCol

          int possibleCol
          This represents the possible future ActiveAgent.colPosition of the object. It is meant to help determine if it will be okay to be placed there, in ActiveAgent.isChangeInRange(). It is set during ActiveAgent.setPossibleRC(int, int) and ActiveAgent.adjustTemps(int, int). It can be retrieved by ActiveAgent.getPossibleCol().

        • isChangeInRange

          boolean isChangeInRange
          When the value is true, the object can be placed in ActiveAgent.possibleRow and ActiveAgent.possibleCol. If the value is false, the object cannot be placed there. It is used to check whether the possible positions are within the grid in the ActiveAgent.isChangeInRange() method.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Briefcase extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand

        • rowArray

          int[] rowArray
          This field represents the briefcase's possible row coordinates. The array provides all possible options. The value is randomly selected with Briefcase.rowIdx, and called in the constructor Briefcase.Briefcase().

        • rowIdx

          int rowIdx
          This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array Briefcase.rowArray.

        • r

          int r
          This field represents the briefcase's row coordinate. The array chooses which coordinate to use randomly selected by Briefcase.rowIdx for the Briefcase.rowArray.

        • colArray

          int[] colArray
          This field represents the briefcase's possible column coordinates. The array provides all possible options. The value is randomly selected with Briefcase.colIdx, and called in the constructor Briefcase.Briefcase().

        • colIdx

          int colIdx
          This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array Briefcase.colArray.

        • c

          int c
          This field assigns the briefcase's row coordinate. The array chooses which coordinate to use, which is randomly selected by Briefcase.colIdx for the Briefcase.colArray.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Enemy extends ActiveAgent implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • canStab

          boolean canStab
          This field represents the enemy's ability to stab the player, which depends on whether the player is in an adjacent square. It is found in the Enemy.Enemy(), Enemy.checkPlayer(int, int), and Enemy.getStab() methods.

        • isDead

          boolean isDead
          This field represents the enemy's value of whether it has been killed or not. All enemies begin as not dead in the Enemy.Enemy() constructor, which can be changed in the Enemy.dies() class. The value can be retrieved in Enemy.getDeathVal().

        • pursuitMode

          boolean pursuitMode
          When the game is set to hard mode, the enemy can switch into pursuit mode, during which it will follow the player. It can be changed in the Enemy.findPlayer(int, int, int, int) method and can be retrieved in Enemy.getMode().

        • frontDirection

          int frontDirection
          This field represents the direction that the enemy was in so that the randomized Enemy.createMoveLocation() method could be skipped, and we can select directly where the enemy is going to move. When in hard mode, the GameEngine essentially uses it in such a way: Enemy.checkDirection(frontDirection). The frontDirection is saved after the enemy finds the player within two adjacent squares in Enemy.findPlayer(int, int, int, int).

        • spawnRow

          int spawnRow
          This field represents the row that the Enemy is spawned into, used in Enemy.spawnEnemy().

        • spawnCol

          int spawnCol
          This field represents the column that the Enemy is spawned into, used in Enemy.spawnEnemy().

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Map extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • position

          int[][] position
          This field holds the different integer identifiers for all the different possible things that can be held on the map, including emptiness. It is primarily used for display. 1 Room, 2 Empty, 3 Enemy, 4 Player, 5-7 Item, 8 Briefcase

        • isTaken

          boolean[][] isTaken
          This field holds boolean values that correspond to those of Map.position. If the space is occupied, it is true, else it is false.

        • isDark

          boolean[][] isDark
          This field holds boolean values for printing the player's vision, which is determined in Map.setVision() and Map.setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

        • playerRow

          int playerRow
          These fields hold the player's row and column positions. It is saved in Map.placePlayer(int, int), and it is used to set the player's vision and for look in Map.setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

        • playerCol

          int playerCol
          These fields hold the player's row and column positions. It is saved in Map.placePlayer(int, int), and it is used to set the player's vision and for look in Map.setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

        • briefCaseRow

          int briefCaseRow
          These fields hold the briefcase's row and column positions. It is saved in Map.placeBriefCase(int, int)

        • briefCaseCol

          int briefCaseCol
          These fields hold the briefcase's row and column positions. It is saved in Map.placeBriefCase(int, int)

        • isItem

          boolean isItem
          This field represents whether there is an item in the given position or not. It is used in Map.checkItemPlayerPositions(int, int) and can be retrieved with Map.getIsItem().

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Player extends ActiveAgent implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • lives

          int lives

        • ammo

          int ammo

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.PowerUp extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • possibleRowSpawn

          int possibleRowSpawn
          These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in PowerUp.spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.

        • possibleColSpawn

          int possibleColSpawn
          These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in PowerUp.spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.

        • itemRow

          int itemRow
          These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the PowerUp.possibleRowSpawn and PowerUp.possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty. These values can be retrieved in PowerUp.getItemRow() and #geItemCol().

        • itemCol

          int itemCol
          These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the PowerUp.possibleRowSpawn and PowerUp.possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty. These values can be retrieved in PowerUp.getItemRow() and #geItemCol().

        • itemID

          int itemID
          This field represents the PowerUp.itemID, which is needed to set the effects of the specific items in PowerUp.setEffect().

        • turnsInvincible

          int turnsInvincible
          This field represents the number of turns remaining that the player is invincible, which is defaulted at 0 and is set to 5 in PowerUp.setEffect(). They are reduced every turn at PowerUp.reduceTurnsInvinc() and the value can be retrieved using PowerUp.getTurnsInvinc().

        • isAmmo

          boolean isAmmo
          This field is defaulted at false and set to true in PowerUp.setEffect() if the player picks up the appropriate item.

        • isRadar

          boolean isRadar
          This field is defaulted at false and set to true in PowerUp.setEffect() if the player picks up the radar.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.UserInterface extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • isDebugMode

          boolean isDebugMode
          This field represents the state of the map, if the objects on the map are visible or not to the user. Its default value is set to false, and it can changed through isDebugMode.

        • canSeeBriefcase

          boolean canSeeBriefcase
          This field represents the state of the briefcase and if it is visible to the user, it's true, and it can be changed through canSeeBriefcase.

        • invalidInput

          boolean invalidInput
          This field checks to see if the input entered is valid. Its default is generally started as true, and it is switched to false when the user inputs a value, used to terminate input request loops. It is used in displayGameMenu(), setDifficulty(), selectAction(boolean), and selectDirection().

        • badInputStr

          java.lang.String badInputStr
          This field is for when the input isn't valid. It is used in displayGameMenu(), setDifficulty(), selectAction(boolean), and selectDirection().

        • sc

          java.util.Scanner sc
